name: Motion for certificates of reassignment to the supreme court
text:
(a)  The intermediate appellate court may entertain a motion at any time before its issuance of a decision, requesting reassignment of the case to the supreme court.
	(b)  The moving party shall state the grounds of such motion indicating how the case on appeal involves a question of such importance as to warrant a direct appeal to the supreme court.
	(c)  The issuance of a certificate for reassignment to the supreme court shall be discretionary upon the intermediate appellate court, and acceptance or rejection of such certification shall be discretionary upon the supreme court.  Neither the failure to issue such certification by the intermediate appellate court or the rejection of such certification by the supreme court shall be subject to appeal. [L 1979, c 111, pt of §3]
